posts.name: Yan
posts.cooked:
Orbit 1690 is excited to announce that we will be hosting online sessions sharing our software concepts on June 16 and 23. Sign up here to receive a Zoom invitation!

We’d be happy to share our knowledge in controls, swerve, pose tracking, and shooting on the move with the FIRST community.

We welcome you to submit any questions about our code here , and we will do our best to address them during the sessions.

June 16, 2024, Part I: System Control & Swerve Code structure How we tune a subsystem Robot automations Swerve algorithm & limits

June 16, 2024, Part I: System Control & Swerve Code structure How we tune a subsystem Robot automations Swerve algorithm & limits

June 23, 2024, Part II: Pose Tracking & Shooting on the Move PoseTracker - data fusing Odometery - skid / collision

June 23, 2024, Part II: Pose Tracking & Shooting on the Move PoseTracker - data fusing Odometery - skid / collision

Please note that Israeli time is 8-10 hours ahead of the USA. Therefore, we request you to vote for your preferred time to join the sessions. *Poll time is for both sessions

posts.name: Yan

posts.name: Itay Naumann
posts.cooked: As decided by the poll, the sessions will take place at 2024-06-16T18:00:00Z and 2024-06-23T18:00:00Z respectively

posts.name: Itay Naumann
posts.cooked:
Due to the high number of registrations, we will be using Microsoft Teams instead of Zoom for our meeting. The session will still be recorded, and the schedule remains unchanged. You can join the meeting using the provided link during the scheduled hours, or you can register to receive the link via email.

Microsoft Virtual Events Powered by Teams

link_counts.title: Microsoft Virtual Events Powered by Teams

posts.name: Itay Naumann
posts.cooked: Just reminding, the first session will take place in about 3 hours, if you haven’t signed up you still can in the Microsoft TEAMS’ link above.
